alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 10:25AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Johnston, northwestern Bryan, Marshall and southwestern Atoka Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1025 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles south of Connerville to 4 miles north of Little City to near Willis. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Durant, Madill, Tishomingo, Kingston, Colbert, Caddo, Wapanucka, Silo, Milburn, Caney, Kenefic, Mead, Armstrong, Cartwright, Fillmore, Woodville, Willis, Coleman, Little City, and Nida. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
